Metadata.Title: A Wireless IDS Or IPS Is Deployed
Metadata.DirectLink: A Wireless IDS Or IPS Is Deployed
Metadata.Author: Serge Batchilo, Jason Taylor, Joe Basirico

Content.Data:
Applies to

  • PCI DSS Requirement 11.1

What to Check For

A wireless IDS/IPS should be deployed or a wireless analyzer should be used at least quarterly. The wireless IDS/IPS solution should identify all wireless devices in use and generate alerts when unauthorized devices or attacks are detected.

Why

A wireless IDS or IPS can detect unauthorized wireless devices, which are proof positive of an attack.

How to Check

Interview the responsible personnel to identify the location of the IDS/IPS and ask them to demonstrate the administration interface. Verify that the IDS/IPS is set up to notify staff if an unauthorized wireless device is detected.

How to Fix

Choose a wireless IDS or IPS solution. Configure the wireless IDS or IPS by following the vendor's instructions. Set the IDS or IPS to alert the staff in the event of a suspected compromise.
